Title:
Morphological And Molecular Phylogenetic Analyses Reveal
Three taxa Of Leptosphaeriaceae From China
Keywords:
new taxa; phylogeny; taxonomy; saprobic fungi;
Leptosphaeriaceae
Abstract:
The investigation of saprobic fungi from plant substrates
in China, three Leptosphaeriaceae species were discovered and studied.
In this study, we conducted molecular phylogenetic analyses based on a
matrix of the internal transcribed spacer (ITS), the large subunit
(LSU), the small subunit (SSU) rDNA regions and β-tubulin (TUB2) protein
gene region using maximum likelihood (ML) and Bayesian inference (BI)
indicated that these isolates represent three novel taxa within the
Leptosphaeriaceae, which is here described as Angularia xanthoceratis
gen. et sp. nov, Plenodomus changchunensis sp. nov and a new record of
Alternariaster centaureae-diffusae. The three new species’ phylogenetic
relationships are also discussed, as well as full morphological
descriptions.. These species add to the increasing number of fungi known
from China.
